text: Only went there once, but I really thought the large servings of fish and chips and chicken tenders were *excellent.*  They were hearty and tasted great-- with excellent ratio of breading to chicken/fish.  The clothes they made the women wear were a bit suspect, almost Hooter-ish.  Nevertheless, check out the chicken strips.
Here's the deal: You get the resources of a major university, the coziness of a small liberal arts college, and great weather/atmosphere, with SUPER profs.  It beats Tempe everyday.
This place's Pastrami is as amazing as anything in NYC.  The canoli was also loved my girlfriend.

Gotta be a stoner man who loves Cheech and Chong to really appreciate the atmosphere, but if you like toasty subs with a great flavor, awesome iced tea, homemade brownies, and great mac salad, you can still show up if you're an uptight honkey.  I always find the people here super friendly, and it's funny to watch all the young punks and skateboarders stumble in and out.
This place is a little glitzy for a taco joint but the ribeye tacos are out of the world great.  Would eat them everyday if I had a choice.

You know you're in trouble when you walk into a Mexican restaurant and there's ketchup on the table rather than hot sauce.  We went for some food at this lame ass joint (my gf had a gift certificate) and the place was totally empty during the lunch hour, but I admired the large screen tvs and access to nonstop ESPN in hi-def if you like that sort of thing.  But then it all went downhill.  The seats were uncomfortable.  The staff seemed confused by everything.  The food was abysmal.  If we could give less than one star, we would!

Let me describe in more detail: literally every bite of food was sub-par, and we ordered four courses.  The fancy quesadilla was literally a big basic tortilla with pre-shredded American cheese.  I could have done better at home easily.  The "burro" had some major problems--chewy meat, crispy tortilla in the wrong way (dry), and beans that will immediately send you into salt overload.  The flautas were so greasy and unappetizing that we just said no.  I've never seen her send food back in my life.  Dessert was lame.

Avoid this place at ALL cost. . Seriously Taco Bell will do you better.  Go to a real Mexican joint and boycott this monstrosity of "Mexican" food.

Yes. Yes. Yes.  Anybody who does not give this restaurant a 5 is a food critic who's just trying to take down one of the best taco shops in America!  We were so excited when this place moved over to the west side closer to our house.  Try to quesadillas and the horchata.

We love this place so much that we used them as our wedding cake, and it was a HUGE hit.  People kept asking us where we got the "specially made tiny bundt cakes" and we just smiled knowingly.  They were easy to work with (and even the catering staff gobbled up loads of them during the party).  Hit this place up.  You will be SO glad you did.

With a name like Earls, you'd expect some greasy diner, but instead you get a somewhat upscale restaurant with an eclectic list of meal options.  Although the place is fairly pricey, the food is awesome.  We tried the shrimp rolls with the crunchy center (excellent), the cajun chicken (which reminded me of the Louisiana that I just visited), and the creme brulee (a don't miss, with its real vanilla beans--which drives my gf wild).  The service is friendly and they'll good care of you.

After a long day in Tempe, I luckily found this place in my Entertainment Book (coupon book) so we thought we'd give it a shot.  When we walked inside, they asked us if we were there for the dancing or the food--they were having salsa classes!  We said the food and I'm glad we did because it was excellent Mexican food.  The fajitas were marinated in lime and the carne asada was also generous.  The beans were excellent, as were the tortillas.  Give this place a try.

When driving up off of Glendale Ave, you get to see very lively but campy murals and 3 massive parking lots before you enter the back door (the main entrance-don't try the door at the front or you'll never get in).  The food is just like you'd want from a traditional, homestyle, local, family owned joint-- excellent rice and beans (all homemade), great enchilada and tamale sauces, excellent tortillas, fresh chips and sweet tomato salsa.  The prices were excellent-- lunch specials for 5 bucks, dinner platters for 1-2 people 9.50.  Give this place a try.  It's a real down home place.

I can't say more about the customer service and kindness from staff here. I purchased a significant amount of gear from this location with both a trade in Mac book pro and upgraded ram on my existing iMac. The staff were helpful, knowledgeable and turned my equipment around quickly and professionally saving me valuable time. I returned today, months later with a faulty charger and they honored their new one year warranty with a new charger for free. Forget the 15 minute rushed Genius Bar at the overcrowded apple stores and come here. It's worth your time and money.

After waiting 25 minutes in line and watching over 10 people turn away, the final arrival to the counter to see the food or lack there of was not only a let down but disgusting. The food was run low, meats were empty or dried to bottom of bins, and there was no salsa, chips, or guacamole. We were instructed that we would need to wait five minutes for the new freshly baked chips which actually took 20 minutes. A total of 40 minutes up to this point and we are still waiting for the manager to speak with us. Avoid this location at all costs if you're looking for a fresh meal and competent service from staff or management.

Finding an honest, knowledgable and friendly mechanic can often be difficult in any city, however Scott Johnson at Johnson Automotive is truly one of the best in the country and we are lucky to have him here in Vegas. I grew up in a family that owned a car restoration business and understand the dynamic between people and their cars and the folks they trust to work on them. 

Scott and his team don't just plug your car into a computer and hope for the best, they take the time to diagnose, investigate and methodically find the problem and fix it. I have two German sports cars and Scott is the only one who touches them for basic service or more significant problems. 

Scott's passion is cars. His attention to detail and love for what he does insures that no car leaves without being done right.

I have had the opportunity to stay at a few Omni properties around the world and this hotel in Charlotte is worn and truly subpar in both service and physical condition. The rooms are tired and outdated, not particularly clean and bathroom show signs of mildew, cracking in paint and tub caulking. During my 4 night stay I was surprised to see room service trays left out almost all day smelling up the halls. I had an urgent package sent overnight and the front desk never notified me of its arrival. It wasn't until the night of check in that they happened to notice it in the back under my name. This hotels location is ideal for central uptown CLT activities but it's in desperate need of renovation and front desk training.

What a great find! This cute fast casual restaurant is a healthy alternative and welcomed here to our community. Informative staff and tasty food make for a great choice up in this neck of the woods. Try the spicy humans or the classic Baba G (eggplant) base in either a wrap or a bowl. The lamb is flavorful and fresh veggies are fantastic. We will be back soon.

Can I press zero stars on here?
Don't go there, its not worth it !!!!! They make you stand  in the line for ever. However, when you get inside  there's no one in the club...  
The dance floor is really  tiny. The drinks are too expensive.  The bouncers are very rude and extremely anal about everything. I mean "get over yourselves!"  They treat their customers as if they were in jail .... Don't stand here! .... Don't dance here! .....  
They are particularly obsessed about the bathroom.  They have strict rules about where their customers should  stand to wait in line and which bathroom unisex stall they should use. Especially the bouncer whose eyes were popping out of his head.  I guess he really wants  to advance to a  bathroom manager.

This movie theater is the best for a matinee showing. $5, it's never crowded so you Can get a good seat, the sound quality is great, the seats are comfortable and the snacks aren't super overpriced! This is definitely mine and the wife's go to for a Sunday afternoon movie date.

This is my favorite Mexican restaurant! The staff are amazing, they are so nice and attentive; the food is delicious, their super nachos (vegetarian style) are the best!!; and their drinks are strong and amazing. This is mine and the wife's go to restaurant when we want to stay local. They also have Mariachi Band Friday's and Salsa Saturday's!

This place is great! The bartenders are awesome, the locals are nice and the beer selection on tap is enormous! And bonus, they have my all time favorite beer!!  I will definitely be coming back here as soon as my favorite beer is on tap vs. in the bottle in the coming weeks! Can't wait!!  I definitely recommend coming here for a chill afternoon or evening and a game of corn hole.

Taco Tuesday's are amazing! $2 tacos and margaritas! It's really unbeatable. The tacos are delicious, the margaritas are good (if there's too much mixer, they will make it stronger) and the staff are great! It does get VERY busy! We had to wait over an hour to get seated for a group of 6 when we went on 9/13. But you can get drinks from the bar and take them outside, so that made the time pass a little faster.  I definitely recommend Hot Taco for Taco Tuesday!
Love this place and so does our dog! The bartenders are great, live music, Trivia, karaoke, and good beer selection.

I was pretty disappointed with the Peculiar Rabbit. I can definitely say that I will not be back. The food was decent, the drinks were ok--over priced, the staff were nice enough, but the wait!! We went for brunch with a group of 10 and we had to wait close to 1.5-2 hours for our food to come out after ordering--no they were not busy. Then to top it, they brought 2 orders out 45minutes before they brought the rest of the food out. It was a mess to say the least. They were pretty responsive to our complaint of the food taking so long and them bringing out 2 orders WAY before the others by comping us 3 desserts, which we shared between all of us, and comping us one of the orders that came out early.

One of the highlights of the bachelor party that I organized was meant to be a VIP table at the PlayBoy Club.  Despite the emailed confirmation from Jillian Parrish at the hotel, $1200 hold on a credit card and assurances that the Palms would charge us if we did not turn up,  they did not actually HAVE a table for us when we arrived.  The door staff were rude and were more interested in looking cool than actually helping customers with legitimate beefs.  Our door guy Jevan, was focused on finding pretty girls and giving them access rather than getting our VIP table sorted.   He finally consented to let us in with no charge - VERY generous considering the Palms almost ruined the bachelor party highlight. no apology for the f*ck up, let alone a free drink was offered.  I was simply told that I was the fourth VIP table that they'd been unable to accommodate so far that night.   Do not bother.  Try Pure instead...or if you are at a bachelor party  - head over to Sapphires.

An upscale yet casual and chill bar with a fun, retro atmosphere on King St. 
Overall great food and huge selection of beers! Their beers, mussels, and Belgian frites are really popular. We loved the Spicy Beef Tacos and Belgian White Mussels. The Bistro Salad was good, nothing special. The Lamb Shortloin tasted okay and is overpriced, as there was much more of the chickpea salad than lamb pieces. 
Our server was fantastic- unfortunately I didn't catch her name :/ She was super attentive and helpful taking our orders, recommending and offering us tasters of different draft beers.
We moved to Fort Mill not long ago and really like Fort Mill Prep. We were attracted to their natural playground and farm animals, and like the staff.

I am a big Triple D fan and was excited to try Guy's restaurant while visiting in Las Vegas.  My wife ordered the brisket nachos and I ordered the French Dip.  
The nachos were made with processed cheese out of a can, not even fresh shredded cheddar.  They were heated just warm canned cheese which made the nachos soggy.  I could get better at 7-11.  Such a disappointment.
My french dip was very large and looked good but the cut of meat was very poor and chewy.  Not like a prime rib dip.  Another disappointment.
I had such high expectations but now I realize he has never visited his restaurant but always somebody other than his.  I was so disappointed and would say maybe the burgers were the bomb but not what we ordered.  
We won't be going back.
Got the chicken cutlet wanted curry sauce nope I got a salty thick gravy .... Cutlet was so over cook the meat looked plastic. Threw it away after 3 bites. Waste of money & time

Worst service ever from Little girls at the register, I don't know how they got that job or any job.. because they have no customer service experience seems like. Just talking and hanging out. If your ordering out They don't care if your food has been done they won't tell you. You have to go get it, but they will cater to the young men and give them their food. Doesn't even deserve 1 star

Gross!!!!! Not even worth 1 star.. horrible.. taste- bland really really bland my kids didnt even like it & they love Chinese food.. disgraced their culture(&im part Chinese, i eat A LOT of Chinese food) they should do everyone a favor & close it Eewwwww!!!! They are still open because Southern Highlands has very limited asian cuisine. GROSS!! WASTE OF MONEY.. people that like this & gave them more then 1 star has NO taste buds. Matter of fact hasn't has REAL Chinese food.. China a go go has to really GO GO GET OUTTA HERE! GROSS CHEF'S SHOULD BE FIRED. DISGRACE EWWW

Probably the worst Sallys to go to. I've been in the retail industry for 15years, licensed cosmetologist, even worked for Sallys for 4 years. So I know how everything goes, very basic. I go here for last min basic items. hands down the worst service here everytime I go, I let it go all the time, I am always charged extra.  Make sure to check your receipts before you leave! especially when they run a buy 1 get 1 or buy 2 get 1. These workers at this location can't compute basic math..wait let me specify Dulce can't compute basic math. I was charged extra for buy 2 get 1 last time I was there I didn't get 1 free. I go in there multiple times to fix the situation & these guys do not understand they charged me extra, they couldn't even take out a calculator maybe they don't even know how to use it... her name is "Dulce" .... I can't...the name makes it worse, but She will argue & argue with the customer because I guess she believes she is always right & not the customer, won't even take the time to calculate on a calculator...super smart girl....not. Its Sallys .. They probably hate their life , she sure look & act that way...but she always right.. Anyway I return items ... Get this she returns it the right way buy 2 get 1 but remember i was charged for 3 she doesnt return the 3. She returns it b 2 get1  wtf I thought you had to graduate high school at least to get a job at sallys. I show her why does it look like this now? (the right way) I'm trying to show her the 2 receipts & how different they look when its suppose to be a return ...    She obviously didnt get it...once again...over it I go to another sallys location. Check the receipt & it was correct, looked way different from blue diamond location.. They need more training in here. I died laughing one day I asked a girl there what is the base of this color? It doesnt say on the box, is it on the bottle....she replies...20 volume....what? The base girl the base not what volume peroxide to use with it..

You want the deal on tv? Well they don't honor that at this location & also your chicken will not be hot which means not fresh. $10 to the trash. What morons hired these morons? They need to quit & hire people that will do the job right.

Got the ahi tuna with shoyu sesame sauce, seaweed salad & ginger.....way too sweet for my pallet & defeated the "healthiness" of the bowl..hurt my stomach a little. Regret not taking that drive to poke express instead. Well at least now I know.

Worst Ever! Do they even want customers?? They charged me $140 for "Premium Seats" im in the 20sumthing row and middle seat of 3?? The charges didnt even show until they sent me my final flight plans...once it was too late to change without, surprise, another fee! I didnt even pick that and would never pay extra to sit in the middle...theres a reason those are the LAST seats to fill up everytime. Ive been trying to call and get ahold of them to make the changes for over 8hrs now and all I get is a automated attendant who after 5-6menus tells me nobody is available to help and to call back later, then it hangs up on me. Ive never had this issue with any other airlines!

Great big thanks to our tour guide, really made the tour. The tour guide is a wealth of Vegas information that we would have never know. Saw Counts Kustoms, Vamps, Welder up, and Shelby's also stopped at the Las Vegas sign. Almost forgot we ended up at the Counts Tattoo shop at the Rio. Very cool!! Loved it all. Well worth it even though we didn't get to see any of the guys at Counts. We booked the tour since we watch the show and was hoping to meet some of them. We did get vouchers for a great lunch at Vamps and items at the  gift shop  which was very appreciated. 
Shelby was a true surprise, we totally loved it and hope to visit it again when we come to Vegas and spend more time. Be sure to bring cash to tip the driver. Would be nice to get better directions to the meet up spot at the Rio but we called Annie and they helped us right away.
Don't miss it, the best.

I love the Pampered Pinkie, especially since  Shanna works there! I have been going to Shanna for five years and she does amazing work. She always knows what I want and what looks best. I trust her completely with my hair, she's never done wrong. She is very knowledgeable in her job, love going to her an  would never go anywhere else!! My mom also goes to her we love her. We recommend  her hands down. You will leave extremely satisfied!

Wow! Where do I begin. I left Vegas days ago and I'm still raving about this place. The 16oz rib eye I had was the best tasting steak I have ever had in my life. it was tender and tasty, like nothing I have ever eaten before. They give you a few different sauces to try, but all you need is a little bit of sea salt and you're good to go. It doesn't come with sides, but you don't really need them. Also, the service was excellent. We had a few different people waiting on us, bring us bread and drinks. Kind of pricey, but very well worth it and a good place to take a date.

I love the food! Especially the whole fried chicken wings! Our server, Cee Cee was amazing! I ordered late but she made sure that my food came out the same time as my friends'! She was also very bubbly and very patient while waiting for me to make an order cuz there was a lot to choose from!;-) Amazing place and service!;-)
Some of the best fish tacos you will ever have! We used to have to drive up to the  Scottsdale location so very happy they opened here!!
Come here regularly. Chip truck quality fries throughout the day and great made-to-order hamburgers.

Went here for my bachelor's party on 5/31. Had a mediocre time and one of the servers got into a nasty exchange with one of my friends. My friend left and we talked to the server to make sure he was OK, all we got in return was an attitude.

Anyways, left a $1400 tab and fast forward two months, I was charged for the SAME transaction AGAIN!! This is credit card fraud. I reported them to my credit card company and will retaliate with any legal means possible.

Need car work done, come here ! 

Once I came here to get a second opinion about my brakes , turns out the place I used to go to ( Fletcher ) had lied to me ... Advance Auto let me know there was no issues and didn't charge me a penny !

Now I take my both of my cars here now . They always try to get you in as soon as possible and even help you find coupons .

Michael called me and let me know my car was ready when I got my oil change, and when I got there he had a prepared envelope with all the paper work filled out for my rebate coupon ! All I needed was a stamp! 

Great service Every Time !!!!!
One of my favorite dessert spots. Unique decor and yummy treats! Awesome central location and fast service. I would recommend the Sesame Street snoh treat. Magically delicious.
Excellent and friendly service !! The store is so unique and makes you want to explore the many varieties of Italian foods !! Not to mention the food is sooooo yummy ! We will be back !!!

Wow! Great first time experience. I walked in the store not knowing anything about e-cigs and left with my first kit and a wealth of knowledge. Jian was great explaining the different types of e-cigs and made sure I left with a customized e-cig tailored to my needs. 

I will definitely be visiting this shop again for my next purchase!
Awesome store! My best friend loves Star Wars and loved this store. Lots of Star Wars collection!! Staff was very friendly and helpful. I will be back again soon!

These guys are great.  I had some leaking problems and they showed me right away the problems involved.  They know their stuff and they weren't super expensive like the other guys I had over.  They were quick and did what they said when they said it would be done.  Great job guys!

Horrible lash tech
Doesn't  know what she was doing. 
Didn't have me sign a liability waiver
Which as a certified lash technician it is against the law to put chemicals near people's eyes without first signing a liability waiver.  
Eyes were puffy and red the next day she added for lashes to a single lash which if you've ever had your lashes done you know that's very painful. I called her and complained she told me to come in the next day that she would give me my money back when I came in the next day she was not there and is now refusing to give me my money back.
Do not use her for lashes.

Im a burrito boys veteran and let me tell you this place is terrible, its like they serve completely different burritos compared to the other burrito boys locations. If you're going to eat at burrito boys go to other locations and stay away from this one. The portions are small, the chicken is chewy.. like u have to spit it out..ughh. ALL other locations are 5 star and are the best burritos ive tried in the city

I was craving steak and eggs - the $10.99 special is pretty good! My steak was cooked to my liking, the eggs were a little too runny but tasted great on my toast though.  I'd come back for something quick.

This property just lost a customer, and everybody we tell about our stay.  Do not fall for the free breakfast bit.  We booked through Priceline, which indicates a free breakfast.  We had a sub-par breakfast -which would have been fine if it were included.  However, we were charged almost $30.00 for two.  When we told the front desk Priceline indicates the breakfast was free, they referred us to the small print.  I asked "what can you do for us?"  The reply was, "nothing."  Small print or no small print, a property that is unwilling to comp a breakfast to save a customer - when they certainly have the ability to do so - is not going to get my business.  What was supposed to be a short one-night getaway for a weary mom and dad of young children ended on a very sour note.

Best pho and yellow curry on the planet - bar none.  When I travel I can no longer order yellow curry because I know I will only be disappointed.  Everything else Ive tried on the menu is also superior.  Give the Singapore noodles a whirl - addictive.  Ask for Diane - her sparkling personality and passion for her work will make your day.

I would not recommend this service to my worst enemy. They quoted us a price over the phone at $225. The person who answered the phone said that a man would call us to set an appointment for services to be rendered. About two days later the technician calls and sets the appointment for about four days later. He gets to the house looks around and leaves without doing anything, saying he may be able to fit us in on Wednesday (two days later). After repeatedly calling and leaving messages we finally tried calling from a different number and got the operator to tell us that the handy man would be getting us an estimate as soon as possible. So a couple of days after that we received an estimate of nearly three times what we were originally quoted. Because as he said via text message "we also have more customers that have being waiting." So after waiting a week we learned that homer the handy man has far too many similarities with one homer j Simpson. Our advice to homer would be stop overbooking your sham company in attempt to see who will pay triple what they were quoted at. This is textbook bait and switch at its worst.
This is one automotive center that chooses to do right by its customers. Thank u Ted and everyone else at Ted Wiens

We have used this company twice. The first time was perfect. The second time we had a minor issue and the owner personally called us and immediately dispatched a technician. We highly recommend this company. Thank you again

When this place opened it was wonderful. It slowly declined to the point at which we gave up on them. In the spirit of nostalgia we finally ordered again. We ordered a pepperoni and extra cheese pizza. On a smallish large pizza we got 17 pepperonis and shuddered to think about the amount of cheese that the people that didn't ask for extra cheese got. When we called and spoke to the manager she succinctly told us that all toppings are standardized and pepperonis max out at 20 per pie. That's 2&1/2 per slice. That's far too few. This company's M.O. is the same which dictates how many pickles and how much ketchup McDonald's puts on a hamburger. SAVE YOUR MONEY!!! BUY PIZZA HUT OR GRUBHUB METRO PIZZA!!!

Dr landerville is a miracle worker. We brought our son in about four months ago when his vision in his left eye was 20/400. Since starting therapy his vision has improved to 20/80. With his most recent prescription his abilities on the baseball field have grown exponentially. Not to be hyperbolic but what this doctor has done is truly miraculous. If your child has an amblyopia (doubt I used the word correctly) you will not be able to thank her enough. Thank u doc, thank u, thank u, thank u.

Best Steak house, went there for Father's day dinner, all of the food from appetizers and  salads,  to main course and side dishes were all amazing. The service was superb, our waiter went out of his way to make sure everything was perfect .  Also, the bar makes you any drink that you want! Highly recommend this place!

This place was recomended by friends. Decided to try it out and Jenny did a good job. I recommend her and her husband who are the owners of the salon. Only problem is that Jenny is the most wanted and if you walk in she usually is busy and she has a lot of clients waiting for her. The best way to get her is by appointment only. The place is decent. I love how my nails came out. I showed her a picture of how i wanted them n they looked identical!! I would recommend the salon but if possible try to get your nails done with Jenny.

I went a couple of years ago to do a cover up of my small tattoo on my lower back. The process up to was fine, emailing sketches to me for approval, tweaking and stuff. I felt good going in. Her artwork was great and she is talented. However, when she put the stencil on my body I did not like the fact that some of the petals, vines and filigree flowed below my butt crack line. She said she would make the petals closer to that area smaller no problem. I repeated myself sternly because I wanted to make sure petals werent going to end up in my butt crack or too far down. She said ok she would tweak it on my body. My issue was that I didn't want the vines to go all the way from my left hip, to all the way my right. So I understand she tried to make it flow from top left to bottom right. I sat in the chair for five hours no breaks. Because of the detail and shading, and the fact the cover up grew significantly larger in size, I definitely was in pain. You can tell the artist was getting antsy and annoyed, to the point where she was rolling her eyes... which I find extremely rude. Finished product; beautiful work, but the only thing I didn't want? She ended up doing. The petals flowed lower than I wanted, and the filigree flowed onto my right ass cheek. When I saw it, I didn't even know what to say.... I was so pissed I just paid gave a cold shoulder thanks and left.. I mean what can I really do now anyway? When I wear jeans, two inches of my tattoo detail is covered. If I had known it was going to flow so low, I would have just made the vines completely symmetrical. I was mad that I was mislead. IF she had told me no, those petals need to match the other sizes of petals or for whatever reason it'd still end up under my butt line, I honestly would have just made it symmetrical. I'd advise you to find another place that treats your customers with respect. And a place that actually CARES and listens about what you want.
Amazing place wish i lived in Phx so i could have this EVERYDAY!
Cheese steaks are pretty good,  but omg the sweet and tangy wings I need them in my mouth!

Best sushi place in Gilbert.

yes even over Otaku and Blue Wasabi

Working with Brandon from Renters Warehouse was an awesome experience. It was really great to have all of the headache taken off of my hands. He handled all of the phone calls, got the documents sent over very quickly and efficiently and was able to help me find a tenant in just a week! He was always available by phone and email. Next year, we will definitely use Brandon again if we are in the market for another tenant! Thanks Brandon & Renter's Warehouse!

I have been coming to Jay for a couple months now and been getting the best haircuts from him! he does amazing work. Jay is always fun and the space is awesome  Anyone looking for a great haircut, come here- for sure!

Waited months to try this place due to the previous reviews. Was not disappointed with the food or the atmosphere. No wait, fast service and delicious food. Everyone should give it a try and disregard previous reviews. -#yolololos

Using my husbands account! 

This was the best nail experience I've had in my life! Jimmy is fast, and amazing at what he does! Prices are super affordable and I was in and out in under an hour for a full set. Usually I leave with a nick here or there on my nails, but this time, they are perfection!

My wife and I have lived in Gilbert for years and we have never found an Asian place like Simis! It is truly a must try, especially in the Gilbert/Mesa area where every restaurant is a chain. The staff is attentive and make great recommendations! The food is fresh, tasty and always served fast and exactly as ordered. We have definitely found a new place! Highly recommended dishes: Orange chicken, Kung Pao chicken and house chow mein!

My personal experience with this office has been very positive.  I've been very pleased with all the work I've had done which has included replacing some old bothersome fillings (the new white ones look SO much better), a root canal and repairing two teeth I had chipped rather badly.  The staff has always been friendly, professional and helpful.  

The thing about dental work is that it's expensive no matter where you go; and unless you have fabulous employer-paid insurance, it's money none of us want to shell out.  I have purchased an insurance program that Perfect Teeth offers so the fees are reduced, and my husband got a CareCredit card so that we could pay for his dental work over time without paying interest.

This is a liquidation type of store.  Sometimes you get great bargains in towels, sheets, rugs, curtains and lots of other miscellaneous things.  I like the fact that although they have some  base products that you will always find there are often nice surprises.  It's not a "pretty" place but it is kept clean and they try to keep the shelves neat even on crazy weekends when people tend to be messy.  Like any liquidation place everything is final sale and buying electronics is a gamble.  If you want mid level stuff at decent prices and don't mind the warehouse feel I suggest you check it out.

I wish I could give zero stars.
Pretty good prices but lousy customer service.  

Today  I went there for the 4th and last time.  I gave them the benefit of the doubt at first but every time I went there and was either standing in line waiting to pay or waiting to get fabric cut they ignored me and took a south asian person first.  When I spoke up and said "excuse me I have been waiting and was next" they rolled their eyes at me and started speaking in their language to the other ladies there.  My parents taught me to treat elders with respect so I left my potential purchases and walked out.  
NEVER AGAIN!!!

If they don't want non south asians in their store they shouldn't have half their store selling West African style fabric.    Last weekend I wore some dresses that I had made with the fabric I had bought there previously and got a lot of people asking me where I got the cloth from.  I had to be honest and let them know how I had been treated. They have lost at least 40 potential customer... not that they care.
my favorite breakfast spot on the strip! A perfect view with a perfect breakfast. NOMZ
Came through after visit to local hospital. Hands down best omelette I have ever had. Nice atmosphere.

The guy who greeted us Friday talked so much we couldn't even explain what we wanted. All he did was follow us and bad mouth every other company without cause. 
If they have a good product or great prices I will never know because after being attacked by mr pushy we left after a very short walk around the messy store.

I received this catalog and thought this would be a great way to eat on Christmas without being stuck in the kitchen. We ordered a lot, 2 of the "large" sausage and cheese samplers, the loaves of bread and creme spreads, jerky sampler, petit fours mix, salted caramel petit fours, Brownie Cups, butter cookies, brie wheel, cranberry chipotle cheese, cheddar cheese, the butter cheese (Can't remember the exact name) cheese curds, and that flat fried cheese that looks like the Greek dish called Saganaki. So this was not a small 1st order, really, I was stupid for ordering so much without having any experience with them, and let me tell you why:

First off, I live in Tucson, AZ and while it is December, the days still get well into 80 degree temps. This arrived through USPS, everything was in its own separate shipping box, (One box completely crushed, but luckily no damage, but that is on USPS, not the Cheeseman) and I do mean EVERYTHING was in separately addressed shipping boxes! It was about 10 shipping boxes all stacked together and wrapped in a sort of plastic, and then 3 or 4 loose boxes. For all being in different shipping containers, I received 3 ice packs total for the entire order, which were completely melted and not even cool anymore upon arrival. My brie wheel was a floppy mess! All cheeses were at that stage just before melting, very, very, very soft. I didn't have the heart to look at the chocolate, but I probably should. I just know if I open those Petits or brownie cups, they will get eaten long before Christmas day...lol 
I just don't understand why they have all that packaging but hardly any ice packs for such a large order going to the desert. If they don't pay attention to where they are shipping in order to pack appropriately, they should. You wouldn't pack an order destined for Michigan, right next door to Wisconsin and much cooler, in the same way that you would to the desert in Arizona. Not only does it take longer to arrive here, but it will face different temps and heat in the mail trucks than the one going to Michigan or what have you.

Okay, so we start opening boxes and I come to the loaves of bread and creme spreads. All I could do was laugh; I buy on eBay a lot and a huge issue I have is ordering something and when it arrives it is either gigantic or tiny compared to what I thought I bought. Yes, I check measurements, but for some reason this still happens. So anyways, I was "ebayed" on the bread loaves. These loaves are about an inch and a half to 2 inches wide by 3 inches long. Hardly a loaf, perhaps a loaf for an 18 inch doll, but not full size humans. I would feel like a doofus serving someone thee tiniest slice of bread ever. The loaf itself is about one serving. Just a fair warning. The "large" sausage and cheese packs were the same way, maybe an inch and a half in diameter by 3 inches long? I knew they wouldn't be full sized amounts, they never are in sampler packs, but even so, I was shocked at the price to size ratio.

Granted, the only thing I have opened and tried were the butter cookies and they're okay. (I think Royal Dansk are better, honestly. I really wish I had gone for the baklava instead, but it threw me off the way it said it was made with a honey flavored syrup, not actual honey. Why? Why not real honey? Anyway,  these issues still stand even if this food is the yummiest I've ever had once we eat it. That is why I didn't wait until eating it to review. I know a lot of people got that catalog last week and I hope this helps someone before Christmas. I will update with the food part after Christmas.

Our company held a party of over 90 people over the holidays. We were very pleased with Crave Grill House. They offered a good selection of foods at a reasonable price and they were very well done. 
The staff were very professional and accommodating. The manager was great to work with, he made the party planning much easier.
Great food, friendly service! I often frequent Tamam's for lunch and they never dissappoint. The Lahmacun is a personal favourite

a great show..we got our tickets through the half price ticket booth at fashion show mall..the seats they gave us were in the third row but right against the wall..so we asked the usher if we could move, the usher got the manager and we were moved to the aisle in the middle immediately. great service..great show.
Two stars cause the salad was crisp. The chicken was terrible. They should use a higher quality of meat. The service was horrible. Somebody please tell me where i can get a good chicken bowl

Excellent enchiladas, especially for being on the strip. Drinks were strong and delicious. I kinda laughed though when the waitor made the "fresh" guacamole in front of us. I dont really think that was necessary...but the hostess was amazingly hot and there are a few good people watching tables in the restaurant

It really isnt as good as locals will tell you before you go. I think its the kinda place were you really gotta get lucky with the person working the oven that day. It also seems like if you dont order any of the ingredients that they offer "extra" for, it isnt as good, making a simple pie get a little pricey.

i LOVE the red rock. its so nice and its never really that crowded. there STANDARD rooms are nicer than some "upgraded" rooms on the strip. they have great dining choices, a ton of penny slots,  and even an IMAX theater. i have no prob driving the 30 minutes from south vegas over there rather than dealing with going to the strip and parking there

After a year of being a vegas resident i found it necessary to pay some dues to bob flay and hit up mesa grill for my birthday dinner. It was good, but I am left wanting more. The apps were good, smaller portions than I was hoping for. The margaritas were amazing, i dont care what color the cactus pear margarita is I am drinking it (its pink). But my entree is what left me wanting more. I had the bone in rib eye and it really didnt have that much flavor. It tasted like a steak, which is good of course cause it is a steak, but a steak from mesa grill should have had more of a kick to it.

absolutely terrible service. either a) they didnt know there was a line out the door or b) they did know but didnt care

if you dont like your job..STOP WORKING THERE!
Fine for tourists, but locals gotta go to china town for this stuff

im just confused on what the hell this place is trying to be..it looks all cool and modern on the outside..but the menu has low end sandwiches and then high priced steaks? The atmosphere inside is that of a fancy restaurant but it seems like an overdone chili's or applebees. The couscous was decent and their bread pudding is what made me give it the second star since it was made with croissants

It was worth every penny. The ambience was excellent (for the main side which we were on) Caprese was delcious, our tasting portion of the sausage orchiette was perfectly al dente, my osso bucco was very good and my girlfriends filet mignon was fantastic (even for medium-well). I think that since this is a Celebrity Chef restaurant inside of one of the top 3 hotels on the vegas strip, the prices could have been higher! Honestly! Yes it is all al a carte, but the sides are only $9 when they could be $12 like other steakhouses. The petite filet was about $10 less than it is at other steakhouses, i think its one of the best bargain celebrity upscale restaurants in vegas.

Came here for dinner, and didnt run into a long wait at all. Food was pretty good, atmosphere was also pretty good. I was happy they actually had a middle eastern station and even more pleased with how good it was. It ended up being the only thing i ate! with the exception of fresh cut fruit and shrimp cocktail :)

If i can walk right past the line with a big group of girls like i did this weekend then i can safely give it 4 stars. holding off on the 5th star cause i STILL had to pay $20 and the music was horrible..and i thought the dance floor was small.
Im a big fan of this place, its simple, but perfectly executed. The sausage pizza is great. Anytime friends and family come to visit I always take them here. Its a safe choice

I am so surprised to see that this place has an average rating of 4 stars..i thought the atmosphere was terrible, the menu was overpriced, and the service is better at the DMV. I dont understand how some of these girls in vegas get these waitressing jobs and make a boat load of tips, yet be so stupid! We saw our waitress 3 times, once to take our drink order, once to take our food order, and then to drop off the check. 

Take your business elsewhere

40+ buy one get one free drink coupons was what brought us here. the drinks were awesome and they were at good prices. location sucks and the food wasnt great so thats why im holding off the 5th star. only go if you have coupons
what a joke of a nightclub. they dont know how to work their line(s) at all in the front and once you finally get in you there isnt even room to dance let alone move. terrible guy-girl ratio too.
I really want to give this place a 3 strikes and you're out chance, but after getting sick after both times so far, i'm done with this place.

Pretty good place, a classier alternative to an applebees or chilis. Quite a diverse menu, surprisingly the more elaborate entrees they offer are actually quite good, and priced well for the portions you get. I'm pretty sure they have 900,000 beers on tap. Pretty loud but if you are in the mood it can be a good time.

Came here for a sunday brunch. Took one hour from when we got in line to being seated at a table but thank god it was worth it. Cleanest and tastiest buffet in vegas. I think the orange juice might actually be fresh squeezed. Great chilled shrimp. Every piece of cut melon is at the perfect ripeness. COME HUNGRY!

How lucky am I that this place gave me my first sushi experience ever!!! We come here once a week, and yes, almost everytime around dinner time there is a wait. BUT IT IS SO WORTH IT. Plus they are really good with their to-go orders. Not the greatest place for large parties who want to sit and socialize alot, but perfect for a quick, healthy bite. Try the tiger roll, it is by far the best.
it was a great show..a little too long and played out..but those performers are very talented. its a little cheaper than most shows on the strip and it is worth the money

We grabbed a few drinks at this bar and I am giving it 5 stars because of how friendly and how good the bartender was. He greeted us immediately, and we had drinks in our hand in an instant. Props to you mr. bartender

We actually had a decent meal here at baja miguel's the other day. They have a daily lunch special from 11-3 daily that includes a frozen margarita, fideo soup, and your choice of two items to make up your entree that comes with rice and beans. The chips and salsa also come with bean dip and guac. I think its actually a pretty good deal if you are close by and especially since the special is seven days a week.

best bbq ive had in vegas so far (ive had famous daves, and memphis champ.) I love the brisket and mac and cheese here. I also think the fries are good and my girlfriend loves the ribs. I think its a little pricey though compared to the other bbq places in town but its worth it. Service is decent, there seems to always be a wait but come hungry!

this place is horrible. go if you are 40+ years old and want to do something that you think your spouse would be jealous of, cause i swear that is all the kind of people that were there. the bouncers were douche bags and though the majority of the girls who worked there were attractive, only one was super hot; but they were all cocky as shit

Weird servers. I dont know how else to say it. We have been there 4 times with 4 different servers and 3 of them have just been some of the weirdest people I have ever had to deal with. I think my waitor I had last time used to be a mime because of the way he was using his hands. The food is the only reason why we come back because its pretty good and we always know what to expect.

been here twice now and its been great both times. the service the atmosphere the food, everything is worth your money. the baked sweet potatoes are amazing. the steakhouse salad is incredible and very filling i might add. Ive had the filet and the burger and man i have never had a beef patty that had so much flavor.

The best rolls I have ever had, but that was about it. I had the chicken with vegetable couscous and it wasnt anything special. I was part of a party of 5 and none of us were too happy with our entrees. The Calamari tasted like it should have been in a mexican restaurant and the pork inside of the spring rolls was way too hard, probably cause it was old.

i cant bash this place since i am persian, but it really needs some help. they need to be on kitchen nightmares with gordan ramsey haha. i liked the food, it wasnt how my dad and his friends make but its still pretty decent
Nothing special, definitely dont wanna eat and then go walking around on the strip, could be bad news, haha

I've been here a bunch of times and if you are looking for a good meatball sub, come here, but, YOU MUST ORDER THE EXTRA CHEESE, or you are missing out. The new sweet and spicy meatball is good too, has a smoky flavor

2 stars = Meh. I've experienced better.

So i have to give it two stars cause i've experienced better. Long story short I dont really think it was worth the price. My vegetables and rice were cold and I wish I would have walked over to Ethel's for dessert.

Hit and miss..hope to god you dont get seated under an a/c vent cause you will freeze! haha. the food is ok...ive had the chicken sandwich which was one of the best i have ever had, then ordered it again on a later visit and was very disappointed. The crab dip is really good, very cheesy. The best thing about this place is that if you order a drink and you dont like it, they happily swap it out with something else for you
After years of hype on the radio, the Brady sauce was ehh. 630pm and they were out of brisket, ehh. Too much hype, too much a money grab by shameless Brady.

Had a heater that would turn on, but not run long enough to heat out AZ home. Guys were on time and the fees were far more than reasonable for the work that had to be done. A great job! Thanks Gents, will definately use you again.

I've know Rich personally, professionally and militarily for nearly 20 years. I trusted him with my life in the military and having nothing but the most respect for him now. His dedication to his craft presents itself with your first bite. It doesn't matter what you're chowin' on, you will not be disappointed. PERIOD!

He has catered two work events and my wedding. Never late, never disappointing and I have never passed on any leftovers.

Great place!!  Always friendly and more than willing to fit in a walk in.  Even last minute appointments have been accommodated.  My kids love the stylist and I'm happy with the service and prices!

FYI... They are at a new location. Southeast corner of Gilbert Rd and Chandler Blvd.

I happen to see Scotts clean trailer set up driving down the street and was impressed by it so I wrote down his number.  I called him to detail my husbands old, dirty, camping truck.  This 01 Dodge truck had deep Arizona pin striping and dust in EVERY crack and crevasse.  He was super flexible to meet my scheduling needs and then even showed up on time!  He did an amazing job on the Dodge.  Above what I thought would be possible.  We ended up having him detail our Titan and as a gift to my father, had him detail his truck as well.  My dad was picky about using a buffer on his paint job.  Scott talked to him at length and fully explained how safe it was.  Scott was completely willing to do it by hand but my dad gave in and was VERY pleased with the outcome.  I would recommend Scott and will continue to use his detail services.  THANKS SCOTT!
So disappointed... Show up as a walk-in and get asked to come back "tomorrow" because apparently the only person that can do fills is not available....
Very satisfied.  Try to stay in the renovated section of the hotel.  If you play your cards right you will have a great time at the Luxor!
We have been to Mon Ami Gabe ' 5 times now.That should say something. The food is above good and the service is always great. See you next year.
1st impression, very good bar service, good vibe.  Once seated all down hill. Our server was a putz, food was good but expected better. Mon ami Gabe is much better save your $.

Came here after reading some yelp reviews.  We were staying at the Stratosphere so it was close by and a much better choice than IHOP.  Rather pricey for a diner but when reviewers said the dishes were large, they weren't kidding.  There were 5 of us, we ordered 4 breakfast entrees and would have had plenty of food with 3.  The Ambrosia french toast was as good as it looks in the picture.  Tons of fresh fruit.

We came during happy hour and it was definitely worth it.  The sushi and rolls were about half the regular price. Not sure if we would have come otherwise.

Quality of the sushi was good - don't quite understand all the negative reviews.
The Viva Las Vegas roll looked and tasted great.  My husband really liked the tuna.  Salmon was OK, I've had better.
Really tasty burgers, great selection, affordable price, clean place and good service
