Answer: Penske Rapid Repair. 

PENSKE RADIP REPAIR STOP YOUR NONSENSE, AND DO THE RIGHT THING AND PAY FOR MY REPAIRS FOR THE DAMAGE YOU CUASED TO MY CAR. 


I will post a link here soon to all the recored phone conversations, photo's and emails.

Had them replace a windshield in my vehicle that Penske Auto Glass screwed up. They took their time, were very professional, and did a great job. They also pointed out additional damage Penske Auto Glass did to my rearview mirror. 

You want to defiantly use Ever-Ready for your Auto Glass they were Awesome

If you like a meatloaf burger then this is the place for you, but not for me. 

Its kinda pricey for what you get. 

As far as flavor and taste nothing to rave about. 
Service was ok also nothing to rave about. 

So what are you to expect ? 

A burger packed so dense its like a brick meatloaf. Above average cost, with average Taste, Flavor, and Service.

Bottom line is you can do much better for the buck elsewhere.
Took my vehicle there to get repaired on a relatives recommendation. They did a fantastic job on my repair and I just could not be happier. I would definitely recommend them to anyone.
Never been before, gave it a shot and was not disappointed, Really good tasting burgers and fries, plus really good tasting onion rings, all at a good price.

The smallest most expensive, barley average tasting pizza I ever had. 

$18 for a little small pie was a joke. They handed me this small box and I opened it up and I just started laughing. 

I think they should be a little less greedy and a little more humble on their pricing and portions.

My advise don't waste your time or your money. There are so many better pizza joints and this is just not one of them

West Coast Pizza. Lot's of dough, no flavor that lays like a rock in your stomach. 
Never ever had a calzone that did not have Ricotta Cheese in it before. Here it is just lots of Dough, low quality Cheese and crappy Sauce. That is not a Calzone.
They must have been smoking the Mushrooms when they made this recipe and called it a Calzone.

So I call to order a Salad and some Meatballs for take out. 

Well for more than 45min I try to call, and at first no answer what so ever, just rings and rings, then it just starts going to voicemail immediately. I call and I call and I call. Nothing no one answer but voicemail

I mean WT@, what kind of restaurant does not answer their phone during business hours. 

The ironic and even sadder thing is that on their voicemail they tell you if your calling for takeout don't leave a message, call back and talk to someone to place your order. 

lol

Are you kidding me! 

Talk to someone??? 

Maybe I would if someone would answer the phone. 

Obviously they know this is an issue otherwise why leave that message about take out.

I guess they just don't care

So I call my wife to tell her that I have been unable to get through, as she is already on her way  there because she naturally thought the order would have been placed by now, she tells me she will just place the order when she gets there. 

Well guess what?

She gets there to place the order and they tell her that it will be more than an hour wait. 
An hour wait for Salad and Meatball's? 

What a JOKE! 

Tell me how does it take an hour to make salad and stick some already cooked meatballs in a to-go container with some sauce and get you on your way???

I WILL NEVER SPEND ANOTHER DIME IN THIS PLACE EVER. 

HAVE A NICE DAY! Lamp Pizzeria

I lived their for more than a year and I can tell you this, It;s noisy, dirty, dog poop everywhere, kids from the trailer park across the street where always riding their bikes in the hallways and running up and down them screaming. people always screaming or playing loud music in the middle of the night. Entry gates that break and take forever to get fixed. I could not tell you how many times cars parked outside got broken into also.  The grills never had any propane in them. Management was awful, and Mark Taylor is a joke. 

There is so much more I could go on about, but let me just use this example to put it all in perspective. 

The review from Scott M on this page, well you have to pay $25 extra for the trash pick up at your door and its not optional they make you pay for it, plus you also have to pay for the trash disposal fees on top of that.

So why would he leave that out of his review?

Well maybe its because his wife Michelle M is the property manager for Pietra.

Also I found his review of Pietra when I followed his profile link from the one star review he made on Raintree Auto body in Scottsdale. 

A shop that did an awesome job on repairing my car, and a review that he gives that I believe as much as his review on Pietra.



***Update*** 

The only five star review made by Scott M, Who's wife is Pietra's property manager is now missing. Imagine that. 

Sincerity Definition: the quality of being free from pretense, deceit, or hypocrisy

Yet Pietra's property Manager, and Mark Taylor employee Michelle M did not address the fact  that her Husband Scott M made a glowing 5 star review of Pietra were he compared Pietra to a resort. 

A clear violation of Yelps Content Guidelines as I listed the relevant section below.

(Conflicts of interest: Your contributions should be unbiased and objective. For example, you shouldn't write reviews of your own business or employer, your friends' or relatives' business, or businesses in your networking group.)
 
No she instead thanked me for my feedback and then attempts to make one think that it is better, when little to nothing has changed besides new motors for the entry gates. 

I think yelp readers would rather have a sincere explanation and an apology instead. 

Instead she just ignored the issue, and then tried to provided more reasons why Pietra is so nice. 

To me that says it all. 

Now

As far as a Security Patrol.

Well Michelle M the property manager states "we have made a lot of improvements here at Pietra."  in an attempt to make it sound like it is a new service, but that was there when I lived there, and is more of an on call service as they are not on property all night long. They were slow to respond and and almost never on property. 
That would be the reason in Michelle M's response she states ( "We have a courtesy patrol service that is AVAILABLE after hours") 

AVAILABLE in that statement being the key word.

Sounds to me to be misleading.

As far as increasing the number of dog waste containers.

Big deal as it does not change the fact that people still have to have the desire to clean up after their dogs, and management needs to do a better job in both enforcement and clean up. 

Now for what they call Valet Waste Disposal. 

Michelle M may have tried to make it look so affordable at just .83 cents per day in her response, but that still does not change the fact that they make you use the option for an additional $25 fee as you can not opt out. Plus again you still have an additional waste disposal feel as well to take the combined trash away in the dumpsters. 

Oh and that reminds me about how so often the residents dirty smelly trash would get piled high up outside the dumpsters. It looked so nice every time you had to drive by it.

Bottom line is that my advice is to stay away from Pietra and any Mark Taylor managed property


These are of course my opinions based on my experiences with Mark Taylor and Pietra.

Had an Appointment with service to get my vehicle looked at. Talked to the service writer for less than sixty seconds and recorded the whole conversation. 

I explained the problem I was having with the car, he told me that since the car was lowered/modified it would not be covered under warranty. 

Then as soon as he heard me say Magnuson-Moss Warranty Act and Attorney he walked away and told me he could no longer talk to me.
 
So let me explain the law. 

A dealer can not refuse to repair your vehicle under warranty without first inspecting and then proving that the modification itself caused the part to fail.
 
It is that simple and it is the law.
 
Larry Miller Fiat Avondale never inspected the car, but rather just took the position that because it was modified it would not be covered under the warranty. 

A clear Violation of Federal Law 15 U.S.C. Â§ 2301.
Great happy hour menu, drinks and atmosphere. Had a Burger and I have to say it was very good, and only $8. Don't pass this place by. Definitely go check it out.
Awesome Greek food. Friendly staff and service, well priced and nice sized portions. Try the Greek Fries they are fantastic.
Terrible tasting Italian. You want to know why the Italian is skinny? because the food there is so bad even the italian won't eat it.
Always consistent, high quality, delicious pizza and service. Don't pass this place up.

Tamari is a great little restaurant: engaged, friendly service, generous wine servings,
interesting menu selections and wonderful execution.

The pedicures at DeStefinos  are a complete rip-off. IMO

When I booked the $53 pedicure, I was told
(1) it would last an hour ,  and would
(2) include  a foot massage   

Not true:  the manicurist was done in 45 minutes.  and 
The advertised  foot massage consisted of a quick rub of my feet and lower leg, finished in two minutes or less.  

When the manicurist was done, I complained that
my feet were still rough.  "You can't possibly expect your feet
to be smooth after only one pedicure."

Excuse me?  and why not?  Every other pedicure I've had
(for much less money) got my feet smooth,

Braddock's American Brasserie is an attractively decorated restaurant, with good acoustics, a well-priced  menu and hearty portions.
Three of us had  the salad topped with a good sized crab cake; 
the side order of french fries was delicious!  the steak with frites also good.

The one downside: the wait staff worked hard but at times  seemed distracted or inexperienced, at one point  forgetting a plate and then  neglecting to ask if anyone wanted dessert or coffee before presenting the bill.

The service and quality of work at Kinkos at 210 Grant Street, Pittsburgh 
is Excellent.  I emailed my order and Chrystina did a superb job of executing it.
On another job earlier in the week Justin also did a great job.

Years ago I routinely went to Bangkok Balcony for lunch.  Food was delicious and well priced.  
Unfortunately, If my meal today is any indicator,  Bangkok Balcony has gone to the dogs.

My luncheon special of noodles and pork with egg and some other things was more than disappointing.  From 1 to 10 (ten being the hottest) I asked for 7.   Now that's pretty hot, right?
Well,  the meal not only wasn't hot,  it had no taste.  

The egg roll appetizer had been CRISPED to death.   It too had no flavor.   The soup was passable; it tasted just like Swanson's canned chicken broth.
(I sent my meal back and we were not charged.)  

I hate to see a formerly nice restaurant decline like this.  Hopefully the chef will right the situation and return Bangkok Balcony to its former glory.

Dinner on Sunday night was a disaster.  
The  butter plates on our table were dirty. (yuck) 
Both of the Moroccan lamb ravioli dishes arrived cold, twice!  

The lid on the coffee pot fell off and the waitress poured coffee on the table and on my husband's jacket.  No apologies,
A bus boy dropped a huge tray of dirty dishes next to our table.   

I would describe our dining experience as surreal.
Doubt we'll ever return certainly not for dinner.  
IMO management needs to better train the entire kitchen and dining room staff,  

(The price of one of the ravioli dishes was taken off our bill,)

First time here. Can't believe we didn't know about this place until now. Very clean, very nice ambience and very friendly staff. Food is awesome with a lot of flavour. Their upside down pineapple cake and baklava are delicious!..  we are definitely coming back here to try the other menu items...
Food is excellent..  definitely one of the best Hakka restaurants in town...love the Bombay chicken, red beef with coconut curry, hakka chicken noodle..  you will be hooked!...
This is the best sushi in AZ.. I call it sugar fish because it's the only sushi that can even come close to sugy on LA

Called them with some questions about their banners, and I got friendly and prompt service. Came in the next week, ordered 3 banners, and business was taken care of in a timely manner. The experience was well done.

Regina, Ala
I flew all the way from Alabama to purchase  a 2014 Audi .  JASON my salesperson  was AWESOME picked my husband an I up from Airport  like Royalty an treated us like King an Queen services. Everything  I was told over the phone was true an honest price, miles, uniqueness an beautiful car.  It only took mins to sign  paper work ready.  He also  protect  an made sure my car was  safely kept until my transport picked it up.  Thank U Jason for an awesome  experience.  Go buy your car today from Jason. 
Regina Chambers

Love the food but hate the wait. I ordered the drunken noodles....it's been 30 minutes already and I was told at least 10 more. 40 minutes for 1 order is ridiculous! Higley location needs to get its act together.

Cathy & the whole staff here are amazing!! They are super efficient & I have never had to wait, even with a walk in. My nails come out perfect every single time & the environment here is so friendly & welcoming. Cathy went away for a few months but since she's been back, I couldn't ask for a better experience! I highly recommend everyone check this place out! They also have a HUGE selection of colors to choose from!

I was a long time customer of MyPublisher before Shutterfly bought them and absorbed them, so I was more than willing to give Shutterfly a try. But I did have a number of questions about certain MyPublisher features that I was hoping Shutterfly would adopt. I have now tried and failed THREE times to get answers to my questions:

Attempt #1: Questions submitted through Shutterfly customer service webpage. No response at all.

Attempt #2: Live online chat with a pleasant person who had no idea what the answers were and no inclination to ask someone else.

Attempt #3: Another submittal through the customer service webpage. It got automatically redirected to MyPublisher, whose response was "We're not in business any more. Please contact Shutterfly."

Three strikes and you're out. I will not be using Shutterfly for my photo books. Atrocious customer service.

Sunday afternoon, around 4:30, I walked in with a group of 4 people.  We were sat right away by a very nice hostess. And we sat, and sat, and sat...for 15 mins we waited for a server that never came. We ended up walking out and heading home. I had high hopes for the Hofbrauhaus, and would have forgiven a wait if they had been packed, but the place was maybe 25% full. I don't know if I'll be in a hurry to head back.
The WSM is the crown jewel of Cleveland. A working market that is a must see for visitors and a must shop for local food lovers. All that makes Cleveland great can be found on the grounds of the WSM.

Kamm's Corner Auto Body was the preferred shop for repairs by the insurance company I was dealing with after my car was hit. Having never used them before I was nervous, but the work was done quickly and quality was top notch.  Where they really shine is customer service, though. They went above and beyond to make the process as painless as possible.

Being a fan of sushi, I couldn't wait for this place to open. I've eaten there twice now, once in the restaurant and once ordering take away and I have to say the food is delicious. The sushi is anything but 'traditional', so if you're looking for the authentic sushi bar experience this isn't it. That said the rolls are large and flavorful, so there is value behind the higher than average per roll price. The drinks are also fun and inventive. The server on our visit was competent, and the food was brought in a timely fashion. I'd eat here again, though I prefer a more traditional take on sushi.

Overall, I'm over the whole Nouveau Asian Fusion trend. But if Asian Fusion 2.0 is what you're looking for, Voodoo Tuna is the place for you!

***WARNING***PLEASE RECONSIDER USING THIS COMPANY, THEY WILL RIP YOU OFF.  PROMISE TO REFUND PART OF YOUR MONEY AND NEVER DO. STEER CLEAR OF WEST COAST MOVERS OF LAS VEGAS.

We were looking to have a stress free move from Henderson, NV to North Carolina as promised by Britany at West Coast Movers in Las Vegas. What a disaster it turned out to be. Britany came out and did a walk thru estimate which we thought was a bit high but our least expensive estimate so we went with West Coast. She is a charming lady who makes you feel so at ease. Don't buy the act! The day of our move, the packers had very little to do since I had boxed and packed most everything. Britany had bragged about me doing all the hard work and so did the moving foreman, I think his name was TJ. Anyway, the packers could not speak a word of English, when you spoke to them they just smiled. TJ had to translate some of the important things that I wanted them to do. The furniture was wrapped real quickly and we thought fairly professional. TJ gave us papers to sign on all the inventory of our furniture and boxes and said that the price may change a little but it shouldn't be that much, that he had a pretty good eye about these things. What a joke! They won't actually give you an exact figure until everything is loaded on the truck so you are at their mercy. Once the truck was completely loaded the price of our move increased by $2300.00. I don't know about you but for us; we are on a fixed income, that was like slitting our throats. After finding out this new amount, we literally had to borrow money from others to be able to get our furniture across country to our new home. Cost up front is half by cash or personal check. At your destination, you must pay cash or Postal Money Order; which means you have to buy about 3 money orders because the post office doesn't sell money orders over $1000.00.

When Britany took our deposit, she tells us that she would make certain that our furniture would arrive as close to our move in date as possible. When your furniture is already loaded on the truck, the foreman tells you it could take up to 5 weeks, no guarantee on the delivery date. Just another way of making your move more stressful.

We got to NC on the 21st of January. We stayed in a motel and at my sisters a few nights then tried sleeping on the floor at the new house. We called West Coast Movers for several days and left messages. No one called us back until finally I left an email message letting Britany know how unhappy we were with West Coast Movers. The truck driver called us and told us when we should expect them, then Britany called and wouldn't let me get a word in edgewise. I finally said would you please stop and let me talk. She was telling me that she was brought up right and that she wouldn't work for a company that she didn't believe in. Please!

Our furniture arrived and even though our driveway is about 3-4 times the length of the tracker trailer, the driver said he couldn't bring it into our driveway. First that he couldn't get it in our driveway, second the DOT wouldn't allow him to bring it on our driveway that it might cause damage. His helper said we could sign a waver but the driver said no. He wanted to charge us extra to bring it up to the house. I told him we weren't paying an extra dime that it wasn't our fault that he couldn't and wouldn't park in our driveway. After getting heated over this, both myself and the driver, he said that they would carry the stuff 75 feet and drop it there and refused to go any farther. I told him that they weren't getting their money and he said you don't get your belongings. I called West Coast Movers in Nevada and spoke with Ashley who was really kind and seemed to care about our situation.  She spoke to the driver and asked that they wave the charge of  the extra steps to get to the house and move the contents into the house and set it up as we had paid for. The driver wasn't happy at all but they started to move the furniture and boxes into the house. As they began, I noticed how horribly packed the stuff was in the truck so I went out and started taking pictures. The driver immediately stopped working and called West Coast and said my husband was helping unload the truck and that I was taking pictures. Ashley called me after that conversation and said that wasn't acceptable and my husband needed to stop and wanted to know why I was taking pictures. I explained my reason and she said that they couldn't stop me from taking the pictures but not to worry, they were working to get us a refund on our move due to our experience being so unpleasant. Up to that point the experience with West Coast had been horrible and you would think it couldn't get any worse. It did! We had to sign the paper saying we received all our goods; which at that point we had no idea since it was about 9:00 at night and we were exhausted after such a long day.

Can't finish too many characters for Yelp.
excellent food, a little spendy. Don't sit in the tables next to the bar. The kitchen door open sand close conactantly
No better place to dine. Owners are fantastic.  Food is top notch deserts are out of this world. Pork shanks tenderloin all very good.
Best Toyota Dealer in the State!  2nd new Toyota For are family from Toyota of Surprise.  We make the drive because we love the staff and love the Service here.  Thank you Toyota of Surprise!!!!!

Me and my girlfriend went to go eat there for lunch on a Wednesday. We sat down in the bar area. There was maybe 10 customers in the whole place. For about 7 to 10 min no one said hi, or anything. They made eye contact and would walk right by you. Just poor customer service. I could understand if it was busy but it was a ghost town and I could see the workers on there phone.

I went to have buffet for lunch on Dec 28 .. there was nothing to eat.. so I was sitting there for 20 minutes and scrounging for leftover.  That's not a way to serve food when you are charging full money ! Left there disgusted and pissed with these people ! It shouldn't take 20 minutes to refill buffet ... poor and lousy service and very average food !!

I was so thrilled with the service Caliber provided me with. Chris called me twice a week with updates as to what was going on with my vehicle. Which is great because I didn't have to wonder or go out of MY way to see what was going on. The girl at the front desk, Brandy, was also just a pleasure and delight to speak with. I would recommend Caliber to everyone I know. They really did an amazing job with my car and my peace of mind. Thank you again, guys!

Expedia was wrong, this location is not on site with the airport. I didn't mind, but it would have been nice to know that and not be surprised and confused after landing at LAS and wondering where the rental car co was.            

Price was quoted correctly, they do charge a $150 deposit, we're still waiting for it to be refunded. It's not just authorized, it's actually charged. The counter help was nice, George. 

We had no problems until we left, I left my expensive sunglasses in a large case in the car; it was dark and there was no dome light in the car. We were rushed to catch the shuttle- I noticed my glasses were missing by the time were arrived at LAS. Luckily, we had time to catch more shuttles to return to Fox rental, where also luckily our car was still in the lot. Guess what? No glasses. We talked to the manager, who supposedly went and asked the car detailers, and they didn't have them. At this point we had to get on the shuttles AGAIN to catch our flight. The 1-800 number on the receipt is wrong- it doesn't connect anywhere. I googled and found another one, and had to call twice to get connected to a call center. After 3 passings around by operators, I got the HR office and left a message. 
2 days later (today) I received a call in the morning from HR who told me they didn't have them (duh). I'm certain a detailer took them. HR told me she'd call me back same day and didn't. 

I realize my mistake was misplacing them, but it's pretty obvious someone took them, and that disappoints me. Won't be using them next time we go to Vegas.

ETA: 10 days later and they never called me back. Lame.

I can't speak for the sales department, but the service deparment is horrible! I have never been treated the callus way in which I have been treated here in all my years owning a Mercedes. People are extremely rude and the only smiling face you will ever see is the guy standing outside, who really has nothing to do with the service itself. If I could give it negative stars I would.

Had dinner last night.  Amazing flavors, the sauces are wonderful.  Like the other reviews, a wonderful dining experience.  A little pricey, but well worth it.  Be prepared for large portions.  The staff is super friendly and well informed.  Nothing here is "normal".  It is truly a unique Italian dining experience.
Fuck the place because their food is like sheet it looks like they make white their feet and the costumer service is so bad that they took like 25:00 mint to take the food

I moved to Vegas from a city that had amazing public transportation and even though I had a valid license, I had not legitimately been behind the wheel of a car more than five times.  I called Rich after my first panic attack behind the wheel and he signed me up for the six hour course.  He was cheering me on the whole time, keeping me relaxed, while also pointing out things to be aware of in my surroundings.  Just two months later I have purchased my  own car and I love driving everywhere.  Thanks Rich!  This really changed my life.

First time to the Market. It was ok. I would have rated this higher except for a couple of glitches. Wife & I shared the sausage pizza, roasted beet salad, I added a cup of minestrone and we had a couple of beers. The soup came out first, per my request. Good with a bit of pesto on top, just not hot enough. I would say it was lukewarm. The roasted beet salad was great. Nothing wrong there. I was surprised and frankly disappointed with the pizza. It looked great, tasted good, but the crust was soft. I was expecting a crust with a crunch, not the soft crust that I got. Maybe that is how the crust comes out of their oven, but with a 900 degree wood fired oven I have always gotten a crunch on the crust. 
P.S. Make sure your pizza cook wears his gloves when handling ready to eat food

Second visit. First time in was during happy hour. Ordered off the happy hour menu and was very pleased with the entire visit and I would have given 4 stars at that time. Today was a different story. Had to wait 10 minutes for a table, ok if busy, but restaraunt was basically empty, but was told we had to wait to see if people who made reservations would show up. Finally seated and were given water by a waitress who was over the top perky. I appreciate upbeat people, but dont talk to me like I am a child at the doctors office, you come off as fake and irritating. Two of the water glasses had black stuff at the bottom. Showed to waitress she commented that it was probably fruit flies. It looked like cracked black pepper or small bits of charcoal to me. Glasses were removed.
Food was ordered and arrived in a short amount of time. Appetizers were ok, but the dipping sauce for both the pretzles and chips were  bland..Ordered a firebrand chicken sandwich, was told the the bread was a flatbread, their version of pita bread. Turned out that it was served on a pretzle bread/roll, which tasted ok, just not what was advertised. I had their black angus burger. Dissapointing to say the least. The smallest 1/3 pound burger I have ever seen. Small plain bun, two pickle chips, two limp red onion rings, no lettuce or tomato, and a petite amount of ketchup that was not enough for the burger, let alone the fries. Asked for more ketchup and mustard, another petite portion arrived. I am a big boy, I can handle a ketchup bottle, I promise not to waste or make a mess. The flavor of the burger was the dealbreaker. It had a intense chemical taste, at first I thought a gas grill flavor, but the more I ate the more it tasted like charcoal lighter fluid.I did not finish. 
I have no problem paying top dollar for my food, but I expect to get what I pay for. (see Becketts Table) I will be back for half price happy hour food , but will likely not be ordering off the full price menu again

Went in to the store for the 1st time last night. Ordered the two board specials, 1/2 slab & two sides and pulled pork sammy with one side. First thing I noticed were the extremely dirty heat lamps over the meat station. Not good. Ordered beans and mac and cheese for the sides. Sorry, but we are out of both, almost closing time. The person in charge handled things as well as he could, he comped the entire meal. That being said, the meats were just ok. Bottom line, better choices out there. I wont be back.

I have been visiting Culinary Dropout on 7th Street for a few years now and absolutely love the restaurant, food, staff, and overall atmosphere. The food is always spot on; very fresh, made in house, and their main entrees are definitely my favorite part of the menu. Whether I sit at the bar with or sit at a table I always receive great service, both in and outside of peak rush hours. Their happy hour has great specials both for drinks and food but their regular menu has great pricing as well for the quality and quantity that you receive. 

I have made friends with several servers and bartenders while visiting: William, Jeffrey, Wyatt, and Chase are the best in business and I won't sit anywhere else except in their sections or at the bar while they are working. They always go above and beyond to take care of me as a regular and I enjoy watching them interact and entertain heir first time customers as well.

This is one of my favorite restaurants to hang out at and I hope everyone gets to experience the same wonderful atmosphere and customer service that I do!

I will never shop here!!!! Their mark up is 75%!!! They offered me less then 20 dollars for a Barbie dream house a riding truck, and many very good shaped toys!!! Take your business elsewhere. I've been a shopper here for years! Not anymore!!!

We have used Gibson air for all our HVAC needs in the condos we own in Las Vegas. Our latest experience today with their tech Paul reinforced our already high opinion of this company. As always their tech was prompt, professional and courteous. There is no reason to use anyone else but Gibson for your air conditioning needs.

Janet & Mike V.

I'm so livid about this companies inability to properly schedule a service call, I could only imagine what their quality of work would be like. I would highly discourage anyone from using them and I'm going to call my home warranty company and make sure they take them off as a recommended service provider. I put in an emergency service request on Friday, I had to call their office to follow up on even getting an appointment. Wednesday was the earliest they could schedule me. I set up the appointment for 2p-6p. Wednesday comes and I get a text at 7:53a saying the tech is on his way to my house and will be there in 24 minutes. I'm FURIOUS because I don't have a way to get to my house in that amount of time. I send my mom over, she gets to my house at 8:20 and there is already a note on my door saying that we need to reschedule because no one was home. It was time stamped for 8:07. I tried calling the company at 8:25 15 times and I only got voicemail. They never returned my call. DO NOT USE THEM!!!

I just wanted to take a moment to write a review for Alan and Kevin. We went into the store to look for a bed after having a sleep number and returning it. This was a wonderful experience compared to anything we have ever encountered. The "sales" associates were very personable, relatable, knowledgable, and honest. My boyfriend and I mostly dealt with Alan, but they were both wonderful. We let them know our price, and they steered us to things that were only in that price range and helped us to pick the best one while giving us the space we needed. Buying a bed as a couple can be confusing and stressful at times especially with a sales person breathing down your back so it was wonderful that were given flexibility and privacy. We got to know our sales person on a very personal level and spent about two hours making a decision  and never once felt rushed or pressured. It was seriously one of the best experiences we ever had especially because we are often overly critical. We love our bed and will never forget the experience we had with the Best Mattress Centennial team especially Alan. He gave us respect, and we will always trust him for that. We are even considering returning for our guest bedroom. We are grateful for the courtesy he gave us as well as helping with the price and the bed frame.

We have went to several Papa Murphy's around the valley, but this one by far has the best service. The staff was friendly and fast. The manager even shook our hands and thanked us for our service. It was very clean and all ingredients were fresh. They even gave us new coupons to replace the ones we just used. We will never go to another Papa Murphy's again.

I took my little cousin for her first tattoo as well as one for myself this Friday the 13th. They had the biggest selection and not a terrible wait time.
The whole shop was busy and all the artists were in a great mood even on a day that can be a bit stressful and a cut in pay for them. Daniel San was our tattoo artist. He was very professional, and had a beautiful machine! I even asked him to rework a little area and he did without hesitation or complaint. Our work is perfect for my 11th and her first!! 
My cousin and I are very happy with the experience we had there as well as with our tattoos. I will definitely be returning for custom work. Thanks again Living Dead and Daniel.

If I could give the Smoke Ranch location a negative 5 I would. I could not believe the service I received there. The office staff was completely unprofessional. They mocked my mother as she stepped outside to take a phone call. When I complained that they would behave in such a way, they moved my chart to the back. In doing so, I had to wait for two additional people to go in front of me resulting in an over 45 minute wait until they decided to move my chart back to the front. And to top it all off, when I called back to ask about a referral that was supposedly sent (the other office has no record of the referral) the receptionist very rudely and with a raised voice said "that department is closed for the day" and then proceeded to hang up on me. This was at 4pm. The office does not close until 5.

Dr. Sikand and Ear Nose and Throat Consultants of Nevada should be ASHAMED at the quality of people they have working for them. It is a disgrace. I cannot believe it.


Please do not EVER go to the Smoke Ranch location. Save yourself the trouble!

The sushi was awesome we tried the Philadelphia, Rainbow, flying Jason, and black jack roll. All were great. The only reason they got a three is halfway through all of the waiters in the entire restaurant disappeared for 15 minutes. The sushi chef finally called them after we looked around several times. Also the waitress was very rushed and pushy when taking/waiting for your order but then never comes back. Go for good sushi, not service.
We love their Hawaiian Pizza. Its nothing like any other pizza place. Their delivery time is somewhat lengthy but that is my only complaint.
Food is really good but wouldn't recommend on take out orders for they're smaller portions than dining in

"Paperthin walls, creaky halls, towel rack falling off wall, no sleep!"

1 of 5 stars Reviewed 3 weeks ago   

This place is horrible. They upgraded the lobby floors for photos and so people would not turn around running while checking in. You can hear everything- even when the neighbors are talking normal levels. You hear the reception phone ring- every time. The lobby TV like it is in your room. Old towels were in our bathroom upon arrival with hair on them. The towel rack was coming out of the wall. The hallways creaked and the second floor was just as bad. We could not get any sleep and had to travel the next day so we checkout out after 3 hours and drove downtown to another hotel. Being backed by WYNDHAM as they advertise is false advertising- being a DAYS INN is false advertising for this dump. For $100 a night...The place needs to be condemned. 


Stayed April 2016

*UPDATE:  I sent a demand letter for a refund. I got a call from the manager who said that she would refund my money IF I took down my review on Trip Advisor.  I asked her if she received my certified mail yet regarding a refund, she said no.  I told her I would speak with her when she does.  3 weeks later and after a few emails and phone calls, they decided to not honor the demand letter... but yet, would have refunded my money to not publically share my experience.  I say this, to properly inform the public about this place is worth the loss of a refund.

https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g50532-d122185-r371771517-Days_Inn_Cleveland_Lakewood-Lakewood_Ohio.html#

Run the other way, not only do they do a crummy job, they won't honor prepaid coupons after Dec 31st. As we spend 6 months in the US, I ,m out $120, they can't wash cars properly and have no idea of honesty or service, great location, other than that, FUBAR

Just got my car back today and wanted to express how pleased I was with the service and results.
Craig is a joy to deal with, a man of his word ( uses them sparingly!), the repairs were done on time and on estimate, he also kept me current with how the work was going.
In a world where I really hate having to deal with service providers, must say this was an exceptionally good encounter, would highly recommend you check them out, save yourself a lot of grief and worry!

Really impressed, came in, fixed all our PC problems, got us some new equipment in less than a week, got it all up and running as well. Friendly, professional, easy going and doesn't,make you feel like you're an idiot!

Please do not go to this place it took all my money $3k and totally didnt fix my problem and still kept asking me to pay more. here my story to tell guy named tony took my car in shop and ask me bout $3k too repair the rear damage and coolant system. after it my car been repaired same day I picked up my car the coolant level light popped out I took back to the autospec they said no problem you can still drive everywhere if I listen to him and drive I b dying now. this place is completely bullshit overpriced mindgame playing. he even ask me another $500 to fix the coolant system since he made a wrong decision to replace the water bump?not even sure he replaced it or just say so?
never leave your car here to repair well if you still think here is the place to repair your car good luck my friend. take your car to another place will be a better choice.

We came up from Florida to visit our friends here in Fort Mill. So of course when visiting another state we like to venture out from your normal chain restaurants. Did a little research, and the reviews were awesome so we decided to give it a shot. An low and behold it was fantastic, I did build your own burger and my husband did the T-Money; both burgers were phenomenal! The staff and environment were perfect!

There is no one to greet you at the front and no one to seat you unless you insist on being seated. This is probably due to the fact that they are absolutely understaffed with one person working the tables, front etc. Once seated we were not even served water, absolutely nothing until we asked ourselves to order. I feel bad for the one waitress who has to do everything so it is not her fault, just unbelievable they have one person doing everything. Once we ordered we did not receive drinks until we once again asked for them,  or appetizers for 30  minutes. #1 rule = food quality is irrelevant with horrible service. I really hope this place gets it together because it's in a great location and looks great as well. Honestly worst service I have ever seen.
A halmark of delicious mexican food, if you haven't had it, you owe it to yourself to try try it!!
love this place, lots of love for the owner. very chill atmosphere, very cool, I hope they keep it open!

pretty good vegetarian food, though I wish they'd expand their menu to more natural foods as that goes hand it hand for me in regard to eating healthy.

overall though, I'd recommend em

I Brought in some shorts to be altered here- the owner is a sweetheart, was accommodating and nice.
Not to mention she's located close to ASU so it's great for students like me to get any thing done they need to their clothes.

The most important thing- good vibes.

Ignore the negative reviews- I'm sure if they were in even a slightly good mood they would appreciate the obvious experience and welcomingness of the store - not to mention I'm sure the owner would have fixed anything had they simply kindly asked.


Thank you ill be back for my alteration needs!

Terrible service

Came in with a group and most of the people at my table were done eating before I even got my food. Then I had to eat alone while 7 people stared awkwardly at me.

Would not recommend.

The food is great, the prices are great, BUT there's a serious ventilation issue.

I've been here twice and If you eat here prepare to launder / wash / dry clean everything you own because its going to smell like a deep fryer. And you wont be able to just air it out either, it's going to need a full wash. 

Leave your suits and dresses at home people.

As always, when it comes to $1 oysters, expect many shell fragments =(

The staff here is extremely snooty and unhelpful. 

I came here looking for a retirement gift for my dad from my family and was pretty put off by the pretentiousness that I just left without getting what I was looking for. 

I mean you are goddamn sales people! Not CEOs. Don't act like you don't have time to talk to me because I'm not wearing a three piece suit. 

While I was there I asked if they do repair work on lower end watches and their staff said "NO. you go to SEARS!" 

Yeah, that actually happened.

I went here for brunch. The food was decent but the service was the worst I've ever had. 

They forgot half the things we ordered. 

The server never showed up again after taking our order so we had to flag down the food runner to let him know what was missing and he came back with our bill 20 minutes later.

This place is definitely one of the most unique sushi places in Toronto. 

It's a bit pricier than other places but you get what you pay for. Everything was well prepared, well presented, and delicious. 

I especially liked the steak sushi, lobster roll, and beef short rib. 

If you're tired of those rancid cream cheese rolls at pretty much every other sushi place, check this one out.

Not a great place for game day. Don't hire enough waitresses. Ashly works her ass off. Drinks run empty and over hour wait for food. Group of 7 and all got meal delivered at different times 45 minutes apart.   Owner doesn't appreciate Sunday business enough to show up. Losing ton of money not serving drinks and no more repeat business.

My friend and I went to the show and absolutely loved it. I was not familiar with Matt Franco before the show and never thought of myself as a person who enjoys magic shows. Matt shares his story which is inspiring and reminds us that dreams do come true. His tricks were very entertaining and we laughed a lot. Thanks Matt for a great night out!

This is the cleanest looking Lee's liquor in the area, especially compared to the Craig and Rancho store. They have a huge beer cooler with more craft beers than I can even count and a decent sized selection of wine compared to many of the other locations around town. The staff here is excellent and he management has gone out of their way to brig in a case or two of special orders for myself and other people I've seen there. Plus this place is cheaper than smiths right next door to it, so it's a no brainier to shop here for all your alcohol needs!!

Best tapas spot in Vegas. Just go. Enjoy. I've gone about ten times now and I have never had bad service or a bad dish there. The prosciutto with fig jam is amazing. Crab cakes are bomb. Plus if you sit on the patio outside the seclusion adds a nice effect to the meal. Perfect for date night. Don't change a thing guys.
